episodeTitle: You're Going Down, Absalom!! Nami's Lightning Attack of Friendship!!
japaneseName: 倒れろアブサロム！！ナミ友情の雷撃！！
romanizedName: Taorero Abusaromu!! Nami Yūjō no Raigeki!!
description: Nami awakens during her forced wedding to Absalom and, with help from zombie Lola, defeats him with a powerful Thunder Charge attack. Meanwhile, Perona discovers the mansion's destruction and plans to escape with the Thousand Sunny and Thriller Bark's treasure. The Straw Hats prepare to confront the giant zombie Oars.

events.title: Nami Awakens During Forced Wedding
events.description: Nami regains consciousness to find herself in a wedding dress as Absalom is about to kiss her to seal their forced marriage. She realizes the dire situation she's in and begins to resist.
events.significance: This moment showcases Nami's vulnerability but also sets up her triumphant counterattack against Absalom, highlighting themes of bodily autonomy and female empowerment in the series.

quotes.text: What?! A wedding?! Get away from me!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's reaction upon realizing Absalom is forcing her into marriage

events.title: Lola Intervenes to Save Nami
events.description: Zombie Lola bursts into the room, pretending to be angry at Nami and demanding to marry Absalom herself. She appears to attack Nami but is actually creating a diversion to help her friend escape.
events.significance: This moment demonstrates the genuine friendship between Nami and Lola despite Lola being a zombie. It's a key example of the bond formed between characters in One Piece transcending normal boundaries.

quotes.text: Absalom! You should marry me instead of this lying woman!
quotes.speaker: Lola
quotes.context: Lola's ruse to help Nami escape while pretending to be her enemy

events.title: Absalom Attacks Lola
events.description: When Absalom realizes Lola's deception, he becomes enraged and fires an invisible bazooka blast at Lola, seriously injuring the zombie who was trying to help Nami.
events.significance: This brutal attack on Lola triggers Nami's anger and determination to defeat Absalom, serving as the catalyst for the upcoming battle's conclusion.

events.title: Nami Defeats Absalom with Thunder Charge
events.description: Furious at Absalom for hurting Lola, Nami charges her Perfect Clima-Tact with electricity and unleashes a devastating Thunder Charge Swing Arm attack, knocking out Absalom with a single powerful strike.
events.significance: This is the decisive blow that ends Nami's battle with Absalom. The attack demonstrates Nami's growth as a combatant and her willingness to fight for her friends. It's also notable that Absalom's previous injuries from Sanji weakened him enough for this attack to finish him.

quotes.text: This is for my friend! Thunder Charge: Swing Arm!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's battle cry as she delivers the finishing blow to Absalom

events.title: Perona Wakes from Nightmare
events.description: Perona awakens from a traumatic nightmare about being surrounded by roaches and attacked by Usopp's 10-Ton Hammer, still shaken from her psychological defeat.
events.significance: This scene shows the lasting psychological impact of Usopp's victory over Perona, demonstrating that her defeat was more than just physical - it broke her spirit and confidence.

events.title: Perona Plans to Steal the Thousand Sunny
events.description: After learning that Oars has defeated Hogback and the General Zombies and destroyed much of the mansion, Perona decides to abandon Thriller Bark entirely. She plans to steal the Straw Hats' ship, the Thousand Sunny, along with all of Thriller Bark's treasure and food.
events.significance: This decision shows Perona's self-preservation instinct and sets up future events. Her plan to steal the Thousand Sunny will lead to her encounter with Bartholomew Kuma in a later episode.

quotes.text: I'm getting out of here! I'll take their ship and all the treasure!
quotes.speaker: Perona
quotes.context: Perona deciding to abandon Thriller Bark after learning of the chaos

events.title: Oars Searches for Nami, Luffy, and Sogeking
events.description: After defeating most of the Straw Hat Pirates, the giant zombie Oars, animated by Luffy's shadow, goes searching for the three crew members he hasn't found yet: Nami, Luffy himself, and Sogeking (not knowing it's Usopp).
events.significance: This scene highlights the irony of Oars searching for Luffy while possessing Luffy's own shadow. It also shows that Oars doesn't recognize Usopp in his Sogeking disguise, adding a comedic element to the tense situation.

quotes.text: Where are Nami, Luffy, and that long-nosed guy Sogeking?
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars searching for the remaining Straw Hats

events.title: Straw Hats Prepare Second Assault on Oars
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates regroup and prepare to attack Oars again. However, this time they must fight without Brook, who is still recovering from his intense battle with the samurai zombie Ryuma.
events.significance: This moment shows the crew's determination and resilience despite their injuries. Fighting without Brook demonstrates the tactical challenge they face and sets up the upcoming coordinated assault on Oars.

quotes.text: Even without Brook, we'll take down that giant together!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy rallying the crew for their second attempt at defeating Oars

quotes.text: This is for my friend! Thunder Charge: Swing Arm!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's battle cry as she defeats Absalom

quotes.text: I'm getting out of here! I'll take their ship and all the treasure!
quotes.speaker: Perona
quotes.context: Perona's decision to abandon Thriller Bark

quotes.text: Even without Brook, we'll take down that giant together!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy rallying the crew to fight Oars

themes.description: The episode heavily emphasizes the bonds of friendship, particularly through Lola's selfless act to help Nami despite being a zombie, and Nami's furious response to protect her friend.
themes.symbolism: Lola's sacrifice represents the transcendent nature of friendship in One Piece - it exists beyond life and death, beyond human and zombie.

themes.description: Nami takes control of her situation and defeats Absalom after he attempted to force her into marriage. The episode portrays her as a capable fighter who doesn't need rescue.
themes.symbolism: The Thunder Charge attack symbolizes Nami's righteous fury and her power to fight back against those who would victimize her.

themes.description: The Straw Hats demonstrate their ability to regroup and plan coordinated attacks even after defeat, showing their growth as a fighting unit.
themes.symbolism: Fighting without Brook shows that each crew member contributes uniquely, and losing one requires adaptation and new strategies.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates both vulnerability and strength in this episode. She overcomes a traumatic situation (forced marriage) and channels her emotions into a decisive victory. Her bond with Lola shows her capacity to form genuine friendships even in dire circumstances.
keyActions: Recognizes Lola's ruse to help her
Defeats Absalom with Thunder Charge Swing Arm
Shows emotional response to Lola's injury
quotes: This is for my friend! Thunder Charge: Swing Arm!

characterSpotlights.development: Absalom's defeat marks the end of his arc in Thriller Bark. His obsession with Nami and his cruel treatment of Lola ultimately lead to his downfall.
keyActions: Attempts to seal forced marriage with a kiss
Is defeated by Nami's Thunder Charge attack

characterSpotlights.development: Lola proves that her friendship with Nami is genuine by risking herself to help Nami escape, even though she's a zombie controlled by Moria's powers.
keyActions: Bursts in to interrupt the wedding
Pretends to be Nami's enemy to create a diversion
Takes a serious injury from Absalom to protect Nami
quotes: Absalom! You should marry me instead of this lying woman!

characterSpotlights.development: Perona shows her pragmatic and self-serving nature by immediately planning to escape when things go wrong. Still traumatized from her defeat by Usopp, she prioritizes survival over loyalty to Moria.
keyActions: Decides to steal the Thousand Sunny and treasure
quotes: I'm getting out of here! I'll take their ship and all the treasure!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some scenes for pacing, particularly Perona's nightmare sequence which is more detailed in the anime than the brief panel in the manga.
Some dialogue and reactions are expanded in the anime to fill the episode runtime, particularly during the confrontation between Nami, Lola, and Absalom.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts most of Chapter 471 'My Friend', which was released on September 22, 2007, almost a year before the episode aired.
The episode title 'My Friend' refers to Nami's relationship with Lola, emphasizing that their bond transcends Lola's status as a zombie.
The episode's eyecatcher features Nami and Franky, highlighting the two Straw Hats who had significant moments in recent episodes.
The anime notes an animation continuity error involving Zoro's shadow in this episode.
This episode had a TV rating of 6.6%, ranking 8th in its time slot when it aired in Japan.
Absalom's defeat here marks the end of his active role in the Thriller Bark arc, though his character returns much later in the series during the Whole Cake Island arc news coverage.
